8059695995Scoony6811522False36TrueFalse2Kelowna, BC, Canada7/[YEAR-0]8/1/[YEAR-0]Close to Disneyland4NoisyI stay frequently at Belvoir Hotels due to my job. I found this hotel in need of renovation. The carpet in my room was stained and needed replacement. There were constantly kids running up and down the hallway on the 3rd floor and the room was recommended to be quiet when we checked in. In the adjoining room there was constant barking from a dog! I don't know why Belvoir would allow dogs on the 3rd floor, or why someone would take their pet to Disneyland? I will not be staying at this property again! Even though I am complaining about the property, the staff were great! Kudos to them!

80608661556MamaJ32332False36FalseFalse1San Diego, CA, USA7/[YEAR-0]8/1/[YEAR-0]Breakfast was deliciousGreat Breakfast, great location but that's about itRoom wasn't available at checkin, still being cleaned. Get in room and their is mold in tub ( obviously not cleaned very well). Room has two beds- one rock hard mattress (the floor was softer). I reserved the room for 4 people yet EVERYDAY I had to ask for more towels as they only put 3 in each day. Elevator is about the slowest I have ever seen!!! There is ONE dryer and ONE washer for the entire hotel( there are 14 floors) needless to say it was NEVER open. (we were there for over a week) Front desk staff was hit or miss, some were great others were down right rude. Suggestions would be to have a hotel guest parking lot and one for the conference rooms as every night they had something going on at the hotel and I as a paying guest had to park pretty much in the car lot next door each night. BUT the breakfast was delicious and location (close to a ton of restraunts, mall, major freeways) was great!

8061226434Brian8622521False45FalseFalse2Columbus, OH, USA7/[YEAR-0]8/1/[YEAR-0]Not worth the money spent2DisappointedMy family and I were attending a wedding in Raleigh and decided to turn it into our first family vacation and do it in style. Staying at a Belvoir seemed to be a good start. The staff was very friendly, helpful and professional and the 1st and 2nd floor of the hotel are nice. The rooms are an absolute disappointment and over-priced. We had to have the exhaust fan fixed, the windows are cloudy and didn't seal properly so they leaked air and water. The carpet needs to be professionaly cleaned. The window ledge had water damage and we had to keep our 1 yr old from picking at it and eating the paint. After we checked in, we found out that you will be nickle and dimed to death. All of these are indicators that this hotel has seen it's best days behind it and is headed downhill. The other hotel we stayed at, for a cheaper price, was far better than this hotel. I feel bad for the hard working staff at this location.

Despite the fact the shuttle was always sitting unused they were not willing to take us to and from the wedding location...yet we gave them a ton of business that weekend. No free breakfast, only a menu or $12 buffet. If you don't care about either of those complaints then the hotel is an okay place to stay.

806231133FOX121231134False36FalseFalse2Wilkes-Barre, PA7/[YEAR-0]8/1/[YEAR-0]The pool was nice3THE WORST NIGHTS SLEEP I HAVE EVER HADI had booked a room at your Baltimore North hotel for July 27-29. About a week prior to that we decided to come down a day early. I called your hotel to book a room for th 26th as well. I was told that your hotel was booked. I then went on Hotwire and booked a hotel room for that night instead. Once I confirmed the reservation I was told by Hotwire that it was your hotel that I was being booked at. This was of course after I was told by your staff that the hotel was book. The first room we were given for the 26th was a nightmare. There were people hanging out in the hallway until 10:30 at night. When that noise finally died down the room next to us exploded with children screaming and running around the room until 1:00 in the morning. I have never stayed in a hotel that was that loud. It sounded like these people were in the same room as we were. I had my two small children with me and none us go to sleep until after 1:00 a.m. When I checked out of that room in the morning and into our original reservation I told the front desk how disatisfied I was with our room and the experience thus far with your hotel. All I received was a "Sorry". Our next room was nice and much more quiet. However, when we booked that reservation we booked it to include breakfast in the morning. The breakfast was a joke. Unless you got there at 6:00 a.m. there was no food left. We ended up eating in the restaurant the next day and waited 45 minutes for an omlette. I will say we did enjoy the pool, however that is about where our happiness with this stay ends.

80626551569Navysteve7155555True6FalseFalse17/[YEAR-0]8/1/[YEAR-0]Nice hotel with great location.Great hotel for Disney visitWe stayed here for a 3 day Disney trip. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the park entrance, but we opted for the shuttle service (adults $10/3 days, kids $2). We ate breakfast sandwiches in the lobby's sandwich shop each day, which also doubles as a small convenience store. We stocked up on small snacks and sandwiches to bring into Disney. The heated pool (and jacuzzi) offered a relaxing break after a long day of amusement park fun. Poolside bar serves appetizers and beer/wine/soda and has a TV. My IPAD was also able to pick up free WiFi service from the lobby while poolside. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous at every opportunity. Will definitely stay at this hotel again!

I give both of these people BIG TIME PROPS, they were very nice and friendly even if under pressure you couldnt tell because they always had a smile on their faces. My room looked as if someone was sleeping in my bed before I got there. I actually thought I was mistakenly placed in an occupied room. It was very un-appealing and un-inviting. The towels in the bathroom were folded but thrown on the towel racks and I had only one wash cloth and I didn't even have one of those small boxed shower caps. I was very disappointed with this. I know Belvoir to have great hotels but this one has not changed very much over the past 10 years. It was actually better when it was the under another name. I figure in time things will get much better.

I checked after a few hours and there was still no room available. Finally, I checked again at 5 p.m. and was given a choice to wait an undetermined amount of time for my room or take a different, but available one. I decided to take the room that was ready. I would have really appreciated an update at some point instead of having to check myself with no phone contact from staff for 5 hours. Also, I wonder if there was any increased staffing to accommodate the full bookings and turn rooms over more quickly. Also, the elevators seemed like they were running way too slow for the number of guests. These things marred what would have been an otherwise great experience. Summary - great staff and hotel during most times, but avoid when hotel is busy/full.

81207331162BrienK54555True36FalseFalse2Mass7/[YEAR-0]8/3/[YEAR-0]Water Slide1Great stay at the transformed BelvoirMy family including a seven and five year old boy stayed for about a week at the resort. Fortunately we were here when most of the renovations were complete. The concerns of past reviews with noise and disorder were not an issue during our stay. When arriving, the front desk was pleasant and helpful. Elizabeth was great and even knew my name when I needed a key to the room as I locked myself out. The biggest draw for my family is the pool facility. Having two energized boys the zero entry pool, water spouts, whirlpools, and of course the water slide kept them entertained when we got back from Disney. They also have a LCD projector and in the pool area show movies. We saw the Olympics in prime time on a few nights. They also have a good assortment of food and drinks at the bar at reasonable prices. As for the room we got a standard two queen beds. It was a decent size and was recently renovated. Another bonus is the shuttle to Disney Parks. We used in mainly in afternoon/evening as we wanted to arrive early in the park. Service was good and we were one of the first stops on the way back to the hotels.

81734361727javakenn44554True33FalseFalse2Hartford, CT7/[YEAR-0]8/6/[YEAR-0]Excellent customer service, very clean rooms, newly renovated, convenient location2A Pleasent StayWe spent 3 nights here. We were very happy with the staff at the hotel. They were very pleasant, knowledgeable and responsive to our needs. For example, the iron in our room was not functioning. A call to the front desk and I had a new iron brought to the room within 15 minutes, very impressive! The room was very clean and in good condition, newly renovated I believe, although a little small, but this is expected in NYC hotels. My only complaint about the room was that the closet was a bit difficult to manage, it is not designed to allow for many hanging clothes. Also there were no drawers in which to store clothes. The closet had just a small table with 2 shelves in it. It would even have been better if it had drawer fronts on it. It was fine for a short stay but for an extended stay the lack of drawers would be very frustrating. The full length mirror is awkwardly place in the closet which my wife found frustrating. The room had a 42 inch T.V. which was nice. The area around the hotel is generally safe, during the day I had no concerns, but I would be a bit more alert if walking late at night on Fulton Mall in the immediate area of the hotel. The hotel has good interior security and requires a room key to access the elevators. There are 3 nearby subway stations and allowed easy access to multiple lines. The only downside of this location is the difficulty in getting Taxi's. We got lucky that a taxi had been coming down Duffield street as we were leaving the Hotel, but getting one is hit or miss. It is not like getting a Taxi in Manhattan. So if you are late for something and need a taxi expect to either walk a few blocks or hope someone is being dropped off at the hotel. There is a roof top club at the Hotel that is just above the club floor. I appreciated that the staff accommodated our request to be moved down to a lower floor (22 rather than 25) I was willing to trade the club level for the assurance of a good nights sleep on the preferred guest floor. It was very quiet and we were never disturbed by the music. There are many nearby restaurants in the area as you head west towards the Heights.

I would recommend this hotel to others and will stay here again.

8190170127Debbie08021222123False32FalseFalse2San Jose, CA8/[YEAR-0]8/6/[YEAR-0]Great location but don't be fooled. It is below expectation service, staffing, cleanliness and no BPG recognition. Plenty of other nice hotels in the same area, with competitive rates, that will treat you better.4BPG Recognition? Not at this hotel!When I arrived at the hotel I was told the hotel was "full" and finding a room with my bed preference would be difficult. I had a reservation in advance and was surprised at this given I was an BPG member. When I got to my room in the "older" wing of the hotel, I noticed a person was sitting on the room patio. It was a cook with the hotel, and his entire grill/cooking set-up with chaffing dishes, outside my patio door. There was a party about to take place directly outside my door. As a business traveler with an early meeting, I immediately requested a room change. It took approx 20 minutes before a new key arrived for my next room. When I got to the next room, the AC was broken. While the room was quiet, and hot, it was also dirty. There were stains on the carpet and the fabric of the shower curtain. There was hair on the bathroom floor and what appeared to be a blood stain in the drain area of the tub. At this point it was getting late, I was on my second room, and I was ready to eat dinner. The person I was traveling with, also an BPG Gold Member, checked in with similar room problems. We both decided to stick it out for night and grab some dinner before it was too late. When we left for dinner, we discovered that when they transferred our rooms, they did not move our parking validation to the new room key. So we could not exit the parking structure. We rang for assistance and were first interrogated over the speaker phone by the attended. When he realized we could not get out of the parking structure with our current keys he came out to meet us. He was rude in responses to us and told us to "take it up" with the front desk people to fix our key. When we returned from dinner, we stopped at the front desk and told them what happened in the parking garage and advised about the rude employee. They said they would fix it and re-keyed us. In the morning when we went to check out, they tried to charge us twice for parking! After explaining what happened the night before the front desk person actually asked me how my stay was.. I told them dissapointing. Not once did she ask if there was something that could be improved or even tried to get any further information. She just handed me my receipt. The entire stay with the hotel was a dissapointment. I recently joined BPG membership and aquired an BPG AMEX credit card. I am a member of a competing preferred guest program. This experiece does not even come close to the same quality as similiar programs.

82699663620joey483013141False42TrueFalse4Atlanta, GA8/[YEAR-0]8/8/[YEAR-0]Service and staff are horrible. Shuttle bus takes FOREVER, you can walk to the hotel from the airport faster!!!4Complete LetdownDo NOT stay at this hotel. It was a complete letdown. I travel for a living, and stay in hotels, both foreign and domestic, 3, 4, 5 nights a week. When I can, I try to stay in BPG hotels because of the wonderful costomer service, and because I know I will be staying in a nice, clean, safe environment. This stay started off by waiting an hour and a half at the airport for the shuttle bus. When it picked me up at almost midnight, it was so full of other people who had been waiting just as long, that I was the last person it could hold. The driver had to turn away approximately forty other people, a lot of them families with children, to pick up later. This was just unacceptable. Then there was only one person working the reception desk, which slowed check in down to a crawl. I landed at ten p.m. and it was around two thirty a.m. when I finally got to my room, which wasn't all that great. The next day when I attempted to check out, the reception desk was understaffed again. I had to wait to check out because I never got my usual bill under my door and needed a hard copy for business reasons. After waiting behind a lady for almost half an hour, a group came in off a shuttle bus and someone came from the back to help them, but ignored me. Then, when the lady in fron of me was finally done, the girl behind the desk ignored me to wait on a girl who just walked in and rudely cut right in front of me. When she finally got to me and checked me out and I asked for a hard copy of my bill, she complained to me why didn't I just use the one from under my door? Really? I asked to speak to the manager, who of course was unavailable. BPG/Belvoir should take their name away from this hotel before it ruins their reputation.

82752313675RyanDFW45555True27FalseFalse4DFW8/[YEAR-0]8/8/[YEAR-0]Good location, recently renovated and looks great.4Renovation has come along nicelyI stayed at this hotel a few months back right in the middle of their renovation. There was a lot of construction which made the stay a little difficult. Not a big deal, and I definitely wanted to stay again to check it out. I contacted the hotel the night before my arrival and they were able to secure a reservation for me and were happy to do so, so kudos to their front office. Check in was a breeze and I was put on the top floor, which is the club floor. The room was very large and was clean. AC was quiet, which some people can be concerned about. About the only item that could be an issue is that bathrooms are pretty small...the door actually opens up and brushes against the toilet. For me, I was not concerned with this, but it is worth noting. The club room was very nice and I wish I had more time to hang out there. I grabbed a couple of wings and a beer and went back to my room before heading out for the evening. Wings were good, beer was cold, worked for me. I didn't check out the pool or eat in the restaurant, but it all looked very nice. I definitely like the lobby and bar area and will check that out the next time i'm in town. Will definitely look to book here next time i'm in Omaha.

82833103207GLOpie54545True43FalseFalse1Dallas, TX, USA7/[YEAR-0]8/8/[YEAR-0]The location, facility, and its operations are outstanding.1High-quality staff/serviceOn 30 July, I came to the Belvoir hotel in Dallas for a conference with the EEOC. While at the hotel, I received great service from the Belvoir staff. I have limited sightlegally blind and, thus, I appreciate assistance from supportive people. As I was checking-in to the hotel, I asked the clerk/reps for an easily accessible room -- that wouldnt require too much navigation for me to locate it. The front-desk reps were very responsive and facilitated my request. They were friendly and gave me additional information, verbally regarding the hotel layout and other important features on the premises. Also, a concierge provided particularly helpful and quick services; for example, she expeditiously got new washcloths for me, plus she patiently answered my other questions, and she carefully gave me verbal directions to some nearby points of interest ... enabling me to enjoy some of the local offerings there in Dallas. Several of the banquet staff also assisted me, as they informed me of all the beverages/nourishment available during the conference sessions. Some staff, in a few instances, kindly brought the selected hot tea and food back to my table. The friendly service was impressive to me. Good work deserves recognition. These staff well represent quality service, congruous with the Belvoir reputation. I was also personally assisted by a manager; when I was needing to get back to my room on the 4th floor, I asked a person near the elevator, who happened to be a manager, for assistance with the elevator, and he quickly helped me. He shows exemplary leadership. The North Olive Street Belvoir hotel staff demonstrated genuine care which is highly commendable. Please relay my gratitude to them all for their excellent service. I stayed there last year for 2 weeks and did the same this year (had a 2nd reservation). I will miss the staff that ensured that my stay was pleasant, but management needs to get on board and make sure they are in touch with their guest. 835644590Mary033055555True36FalseFalse2New Jersey8/[YEAR-0]8/10/[YEAR-0]This hotel is within walking distance to King Street and a close drive to the DC area. Parking is at a cost everywhere and at every hotel. The Belvoir's fee is $20/night to park, but I feel if the rates are reasonable for the hotel (which this had when I booked), it's well worth the $$$ for the underground parking garage.2Second time stayThis was our second time staying at the Belvoir in Alexandria. After our first stay I had a few small issues, which were virtually non existent during this stay because obviously the management listens and tries very hard to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We came from NJ with extended family from Washington State. We had two rooms on the same floor. Both of the rooms were comfortable, spacious, and clean. Pool was closed for one day when we went down, which was not the fault of the hotel but someone who allowed their small child to swim in it without a proper swim diaper. They had to thorougly clean and shock the pool for everyone's health safety. Lifeguard was great to have but really should keep a better eye on the pool. One guard had headphones in and was on her computer while parents were allowing their small children in the whirlpool, and others were throwing a ball back and forth between the pool and whirlpool. . During our last stay, the lifeguard was so good, she wouldn't allow my 13 year old in. The sign specifically says ages 16 and up. Not only is it a safety hazard for small children to use a hot tub, but it makes it less enjoyable for the adults to use.Only suggestion I have again is to remove the non gratis water from the rooms because this is the second time we got charged for water that we didn't drink. We brought water from home but I think if the maid sees empty water bottles in the recycling pail or garbage, you get charged. If water is available for sale in the vending machines on the floor, there really is no need to put it in the rooms.

Pretty inconvenient to say the least and somewhat misleading language is used on the card promoting this service. It doesn't make it clear what the limitations are and you could a lot better to insure that guests know what to expect if they elect to use this service. 84341153054Anonymous55555True37FalseFalse2Bedford, IN 47421, USA8/[YEAR-0]8/13/[YEAR-0]Great value for the money...should easily be rated a 4 star hotel2Right in the heart of downtownThis hotel was within a short walking distance from major shopping areas, multiple upscale and medium scale restaurants, as well as the local venues for both concerts (the reason for our most recent stay) and various hometown sports teams. The hotel had a very modern, lovely decor, with an understated elegance. We were located on the Club Level, and enjoyed the manager's evening complimentary cocktail hour, as well as a refreshing continental breakfast. The parking was convenient-although we normally use the valet service, we were unable to park at the hotel entrance due to two large coach buses blocking the area. We were given a complimentary parking permit, as my husband and I had driven in from different areas of the state, and required two parking spaces during our stay. The staff were very courteous & accomodating. We will definitely stay at the Belvoir again!

When I open the door, it is the cleaning person, asking when I will check out. Now, 8:30 is in no way close to the checkout time, and I was not delaying her job by trying to get my rest. So my response is that I don't know when I will be checking out. She then demands an estimate of when I think I will be checking out. After a late night this was the last thing I wanted to deal with at 8:30 in the morning. After that encounter I begin to get ready for the day, since I was alerady awake. After about 20 minutes out of bed, I see a huge bug crawling where I had just slept. Not my idea of a friendly or clean hotel, and I will not be visiting any time in the near future.

Being an BPG gold member & owners of 2 villas in the USVI,we made a fabulous choice & will stay here again (and are looking forward to it!). We had to stay close to home and chose the AC Sheration (and glad we did). It's clean,cheery and is sure to satisfty you. As for the parking,it's well worth the small fee considering that you're in AC & parking is at a premium everywhere in the city. We stayed club level (what an added treat),& staff throughout the whole hotel treated us excellently (as well as superb BPG recognition). As far as the pool goes,yes,it is small & needs a little more attention,but if staying here in the summer,you have the whole Atlantic ocean at your doorstep! Well done & looking forward to another stay in the near future!

8476003468Cadpig55555True46FalseFalse2Minnesota, USA8/[YEAR-0]8/14/[YEAR-0]They often offer incredible discounts that allows a modest family to feel deluxe!3Extra magical stayIt had been several years since our family had stayed at the Dolphin so we were excited about the opportunity to return. We had such an awesome experience the previous time we were worried we might be let down. Well, no need to worry. Our stay was equally as incredible. There are so many outstanding features at the Dolphin. The choice of pools is amazing. It doesn't matter what age you are the Dolphin has the perfect pool for you. Small children? Zero entry and a slide. Teens? lap pool and lounge pool. Adults? Bring me a mai tai please, I'm sun bathing! For food you can go economy and stock your cubby with bread peanut butter and milk, you can eat very reasonably at the Fountain or Buffeteria or you can live it up at one of the fine steak or italian restaurants on site. Our maid service was fantastic. Though you can choose to skip the maid service for BPG points. Personally I love returning to a fresh room! For those who say it lacks the "Disney" feel i disagree. On our last morning we walked to the early morning entry for epcot, road Soaring and Mission Space, took the boat over to Hollywood Studios for their opening, returned to the hotel for an afternoon of lounging and relaxation at the pool and capped off the evening by walking to epcot for supper, enjoying illuminations and then taking the monorail to magic kingdom for the extra magic hours. How much more Disney do you want?! Everyone was wonderful and helpful. Our view was awesome. Every morning i woke just a bit early to enjoy a cup of the starbucks coffee on my balcony. I hope I can return again someday.

8476591417Anna0111132False36FalseFalse2San Francisco, CA8/[YEAR-0]8/14/[YEAR-0]This hotel does not know what customer service is!4Terrible service- our room type was given away at check inI made this reservation through BPG using my points with a room with 2 beds since we were travelling with 2 children. I called the hotel day of arrival at 8pm to confirm bedtype and notified them that we are arriving after midnight since we were driving from San Francisco. When we checked in at 1:45am, John the night manager said that we have a reservation for a King bed, I said no, we reserved a room with 2 beds and told him that I called earlier today to ensure this is in place. I showed him my confirmation indicating 2 double beds. The only thing he could say is that they are sold out and he cant do anything. Obviously they gave away my room to someone else and my family and I were inconvenienced especially arriving so late. Everyone was tired from the trip, and we had to wait for a rollaway to be sent up to the room. There were only 2 bath towels in the bathroom. My husband and I had to squeeze in a King bed with one of our kids. The thing that was most disturbing to me was there was NO empathy given by the night manager, no emotions whatsoever, and he was absolutely not sorry that this happend. He did not give a sincere apology and did not offer any solutions. He said that he would move us to a room with 2 beds the next day. Well this is just another inconvenience for us. The next day when we called the front desk to get an update on the room move, the agent did not even offer assistance to move our luggage to the new room, instead they just sent the keys up and we had to move our own luggage. This hotel does not understand what customer service is. There was no service promise whatsoever. Very dissappointed!

84834361291Kim4855555True4FalseFalse28/[YEAR-0]8/15/[YEAR-0]honesty of staffI was a guest at your hotel on 8/6 with Delta Airlines. We are new to your hotel and as a flight attendant who has stayed in San Antonio for years, I am very glad to be staying at your beautiful establishment. After 26 years of flying I have never left anything behind in my room. This was not the case for my stay with you as I left my I-pad on the desk. I didn't realize it until I got home later that evening. You can imagine my anxiousness. I immediately called the hotel and was transferred to loss prevention. I spoke to Joseph and to my surprise he told me it had been turned in by housekeeper Rachel. I couldn't believe it! He told me to call his boss, Jimmy, the next morning to make arrangements for its return. When I spoke to Jimmy the next morning he was so gracious and told me how things like this were normally handled. He shipped it overnight to my home and I received it the next morning. I can not thank everyone involved enough, especially Rachel. Her honesty and integrity is something I don't see very often in my line of work! I have told this story to many of my friends and co-workers and everyone has the same shocked look on their face as I did when Joseph told me he had my I-pad. Please except my sincere thanks to everyone involved. I hope to come back soon and thank them all in person.

I was a little unhappy that you have to pay for wi-fi however the hotel offered computers and a printer at no charge which was very handy when I wanted to print out coupons for attractions I was going to. I was very impressed with the hotel as a whole and I will plan on returning in the future as well as recommending it to others.

8490830127Brian1034243False33FalseFalse2San Antonio8/[YEAR-0]8/15/[YEAR-0]Great location and wonderful view4Know All The Hidden CostsWhenever anyone may be looking to comparing the total costs of staying at a hotel, be sure to know about this Belvoir: No refrigerator, but there is a stocked 'charge per item' refrigerator in the room ($9.00 for a liter of water); Internet charges $12 or $18 per night depending on speed; $15 continental breakfast (very poor quality); and expensive "self-park" charges. The room had a spectaular view, but the carpet has significant stains. The bed was very comfortable with a good variety of pillows. Nothing special about the complementary soaps, shampoos, etc. My recommendation: carefully evaluate all the micro-charges that can significantly increase the 'per-night' charge for this hotel.

Juan at the front desk was very rude and told us that we would have to stay in the other tower (Marina Tower). We drove back over to the other tower and found our rooms after walking to the opposite side of the tower, outside and down some stairs. The rooms were filthy and extremely small. I would not have paid $50 to stay in these rooms called the 'Lanai Tower'. The doors were facing an open outdoor style hallway facing a dirty rundown parking lot with no type of security. Juan at the front desk did not even bother to give us any details about this room. We had 3 adults and 4 children and the rooms were too small to accommodate everyone as I specifically requested some roll away beds which were not available in this location. I tried to explain to the desk clerk that these were definitely not the rooms I reserved and they were unable to accommodate our needs. She did not seem to understand me and kept saying they had no availability and the rooms in the Bay Tower were EXACTLY the same. I do not understand how I could have a reservation and not be able to check in to the rooms I reserved. We ended up staying the night in these rooms and being moved the next day to the rooms I originally reserved. The rooms in the Bay Tower were much nicer, cleaner and larger so the fact that we kept being told they were the same is not true. I was upset over this entire experience and will not be staying here again. Also, if you are military or veteran, stay away! We paid for the rooms using military vouchers and I suspect that is why our rooms were downgraded! NOTE: We were comped breakfast and parking (both very overpriced!) after a long argument with the desk clerk at 2AM!

Definitely go with the points!

88021981272671412131False36FalseFalse28/[YEAR-0]8/18/[YEAR-0]Disappointing3DisappointedYou would think a hotel in such a prime location would be unforgettable ... unfortunately our stay here was disappointing. First, we arrived promptly at our indicated check-in time but had to wait an hour and a half because our suite wasn't ready. We were given a $30 food credit that just didn't seem to satisfy. And this was offered only after my wife and I pressured the staff for some kind of compensation. Second, I booked a suite expecting to be amazed but only came to discover the room was very average at best. The room was small with no barrier between the living room area and master bed. It was as though the hotel took an oversized room and crammed as much furniture into it as possible. Third, the balcony view was very nice but, again, for a suite, of which there are only eight of in the entire hotel, you would think the balcony would stand out from an average room, nope. It was small and only big enough to fit two pieces of stock lawn furniture and a table the size of a small pizza. Unfortunately, we won't be staying here again.

8805897115Rex6112121False46FalseFalse4Austin, TX, USA8/[YEAR-0]8/18/[YEAR-0]Don't be in a hurry.4Better skip Birmingham next timeThe check in process was very long. While there were 8 stations available to check into this downtown hotel, only two were manned. The line was not that long, but it took us over half an hour to check in. There was no special consideration for BPG members. There was no local free parking. There was only self park ($12) or valet ($20). The valet service was the only bright spot of this whole stay. There was no concierge/club level lounge available, which I found hard to believe from a large, downtown hotel. Breakfast buffet for two was $35 and the quality and service were in line with a $3.50 buffet for two. I had received a $25 BPG gift reward that was not honored. The next night we stayed at a Belvoir in Charlotte where all these negatives were reversed which helped restore my faith in the chain. Keep a low level of expectation if you want to stay at the Belvoir Birmingham, and you'll be OK.

I would recommend this hotel and would go there again in a minute.

This is one of the nicer Belvoirs, and everything is beautiful inside. The staff are very helpful, and it's an incredibly good value for the money. It's particularly good if you have business in the Clayton or Maplewood area...very convenient, and some good restaurants nearby, or a short drive away. I'd highly recommend this hotel for business travelers in the St. Louis area.

I was hoping for a more proactive and helpful approach from someone who clearly lives within an hour of the sea. We didn't eat here and chose to shop locally for our breakfasts. Limited wine selection in the bar was disappointing.There is a great free shuttle service to King Street and the airport, and the Metro into DC is walkable and very handy. Parking is expensive. If you just go for a room, it's worth it. If you add on all the extras it can be pricey.

9265051664Recon43233True63FalseFalse4Chapel Hill, NC8/[YEAR-0]8/20/[YEAR-0]Know how to find the Director of Front Office...in the event of any issues4Front Office Manager saves the "Stay"!My initial experience beginning with check-in, was a true nightmare. I had reserved a total of four rooms and had my team members checking in and out at different times...all of which were clearly documented on the four individual reservations. As a Lifetime Platinum guest, I have become used to spending no more than five minutes at the reception desk and then I am off to continue my very busy schedule. In this case, I stood at the counter for over one and one half hours, trying to get these four rooms set for my staff's arrival later in the day...to say that I was beginning to get a bit cranky, would be an understatement. Enter the ProActive Front Office Director. In my 700 plus stays with Grandbourne, I would be correct to say that I have had similar occurrences...with one significant difference...This astute gentleman was not there...fortunately, he was in attendance here. There is something about this outstanding individuals demeanor that emphasizes his sincere apology...individuals can say "I'm sorry" all day long and you have a sense that they don't really mean it. This Front Office Manager is a very self-assured gentleman. He also demonstrates a sincere concern...empathy...for what his guests are dealing with. He was able to resolve the situation within a matter of a couple of minutes and I was on my way. I ran into him in other locations on the property throughout the stay and he was most gracious, asking how my stay was going and offering to do whatever was necessary to provide a positive experience on the property. This young man clearly understands interpersonal relationshipshe gets it! He understands hospitality and the associated responsibility of providing within Grandbourne guidelines, all that Grandbourne promises and then some to each of his guests. In my global travels of the past 40 years, I can say without reservation that this individual represents the very best qualities for success in your business, both professionally and personally...you are incredibly fortunate to have him in your employ.

The toilet sounded like it was constantly filling and we had to call down about it. The vending machine on our floor ate our money, the one on the next floor was broken and the one two floors down that did work served us a warm bottle of water. There were also gnats in the bathroom, many of which were deceased and stuck to the ceiling because of the moisture that built up due to the lack of a fan. We ordered coffee, fruit and cereal for breakfast, which was fine. However, we were also brought butter, jam, syrup and ketchup on our tray, which was just weird. We did like the shuttle service and the pool was fine.

98460901133Dmilsi44444True54FalseFalse4Kuwait8/[YEAR-0]8/24/[YEAR-0]3Pleasantly SurprisedI wasn't relishing the thought of staying in Ontario during an August heat wave, but this hotel made it a more pleasant experience. I was struck by the friendliness of all the staff including Frankie at the front desk, who recognized my BPG status by assigning me a room on the Club floor and giving me amenity points as well as lounge vouchers for evening hors d'oeuvres and breakfast. The room was compact, but had a comfy arm chair and an ultra-comfy bed. There was a flat-screen TV and speedy, complimentary WiFi. I used the gym, which had a good array of equipment, but didn't see the pool. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, along with fruit (including fresh berries), yogurt, cereal etc. All in all, a great stay.

9858870379Hutch55555True56FalseFalse1Sutton, MA, USA8/[YEAR-0]8/25/[YEAR-0]Look at the hotel map when booking a room to make sure that the specific location meets your needs.1Excellent experienceWe stayed in an ocean view room and were very happy with the view, decor, and cleanliness.
98590081727Accountess44444True46FalseFalse2OH8/[YEAR-0]8/25/[YEAR-0]It's very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful.1Satisfied customerMy stay at the Belvoir was 8/19/12 through 8/24/12. The hotel entrance is on a very narrow one way street. Upon my arrival, there was a limo blocking part of the street where guests could park their car to check-in. Since I didnt think there was a place to park, I drove around the block and found a parking lot to park my car while I walked to the hotel to check-in and inquire about the parking. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Belvoir doesnt have any parking, but they recommended a lot one street over. You can have valet service parking which is $39 a day w/ in and out privileges or you can walk over and pick up car on your own for $25 a day which I chose to do. Now on your first day at the hotel, they will have someone drive your car to the lot without being charged the valet cost. However, you will have to pick your car up on day of departure if you dont want to pay $39 a day. Not a big deal since lot is a short walking distance, but it is in a sketchy area. The best thing to do is not have a car to park. There is plenty of public transportation. Buy an MTA card with unlimited usage, depending on your stay, and you can take the bus or subway all day long. I bought a 7-day card for $29 and never had to use my car. Anyway, back to the hotel. Its very nice. The room was very clean with white linens. Bed and pillows were very comfy. I had a room with two double beds. There was an armoire sized closet to hang clothes, but no drawers. There is a safe for money or jewelry. Easy to use with a swipe of a credit card instead of having to remember a code. There is a large desk and chair if you need to work. I didnt because I was on vacation, yay! There is a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee available. Water was provided for a charge. Not sure if coffee was free or not since Im not a coffee drinker. The 42 TV was nice, although the cable connection needs fixing. Short breaks in programs every now and then causing missed dialogue. Maybe wifi has something to do with it, which is free in the lobby. The view from my room was horrible. Looked at a construction site with large crane lovely. Didnt really bother me though because the location of the crane was actually helpful when trying to get my sense of direction outside the hotel. I could just look up and find the crane and know where hotel was. The hotel has a small pool, hot tub, and sunning area on the second floor. The second floor also has a work out area that can be accessed with your room key, which is really a card. (who uses keys anymore, right?) Also, youll need keycard to use elevator to go to your room. Pain in the pants, but good security measure. Another feature to your room, you can earn $5 coupon if you dont have maid service every day. Keepin it green gets you $5 off at their restaurant. Grubsteak is the hotel restaurant. Had breakfast there one morning with coupon in hand. No other customers were in the restaurant probably because it was like a freezer in there. The thermostat had to be set at 600, so much for going green. Brrrrr. I like it cold, but that was too cold. I think it probably drove a few customers away while I was there too. Now, about the surrounding area. During the day, theres plenty of hustle and bustle. No need to feel afraid to roam the streets. Juniors restaurant is very close. Juniors is a diner thats famous for their cheesecake. There are also plenty of pizza shops to buy a slice of pie. To go downtown Manhattan, the Jay St. subway station is just a couple streets over from the hotel. Brooklyn Heights is a very nice area that you can get to on foot. To get into eastern part of Brooklyn, walk to Myrtle Ave. and take the B54 into Ridgewood. This is during the day. At night, you have to be more cautious. The area is dark and deserted. Keep in mind when returning to your hotel. The area is in transition with lots of construction going on. The price of this hotel is much cheaper than in Manhattan and quality of hotel is probably better, as well. I enjoyed my stay and would not hesitate to stay here again.

The continental breakfast was adequate... come on people, it's a continental breakfast...you can't expect a ten course hot meal!!! The staff was very friendly, and checking in and out was a breeze. I highly recommend!

Waking up to the ocean and seeing the sun rise every day was wonderful.

Numerous times i was told by the Belvoir's resident meteriologists that this would never happen. I told them what a predicament this left me in being unable to cancel or reschedule. I would have to begin my travels on friday morning, a 4 hour+ drive from Fort Lauderdale (our friends from Baltimore were traveling a much greater distance to reach us first of course). If an evacuation was ordered while driving down i would have to turn around. If it occurred after i got there, it could be an 8 hour drive for nothing. But instead of offering me to reschedule or cancel so that i could go to another Belvoir in say Orlando, Holly at the front desk told me that's why people get Travel Insurance. So given my predicament and the condescending attitudes, it was either travel 4+ hours on friday with the hopes of being able to stay more than 24 hours or sacrifice 24,000 points and several hundred dollars on the 2nd suite i also reserved (trying my best to not be specific).

10035401468WolfReview55555True36FalseFalse3Charlotte, NC, USA8/[YEAR-0]8/31/[YEAR-0]Daily Early/Late Entry to Disney Parks. Free Boat Service to Disney Epcot, Disney Hollywood Studios, The Boardwalk and Free Buses to All Disney Waterparks and Theme Parks.3Dolphin Delivers Disney to DoorstepWe've stayed at this hotel several times. Each time it proves to be one of the best experiences of our Disney vacation. Cocktails at the lobby bar are top notch and always quick to relax at the indoor fountains. There are GREAT restaurants, our favorite is Kimonos Sushi Bar-- never disappoints. They even have Karaoke late nite. The boat service is free and runs to The Boardwalk-- where you can buy food, pizza, and there are restaurants including ESPN and a Dancehall. More importantly the boats run to Disney Hollywood Studios and Epcot-- which is always a fun way to arrive. And as a Disney hotel you get free early/late access to the parks. Free buses to all the other Disney Parks. The Mandara Spa is always a relaxing experience-- with specials often available. The Pool is huge (there are actually several pools) has a waterslide, and at least 3 Whirlpools/Hot Tubs. The Cabanas Bar offers great poolside drinks and snacks. Check out the basement restaurant which also has sundries like candy, snacks, sandwiches and dinner specials you can take to go -- cheaper than room service. Usually a bit higher priced than other BPG hotels in Orlando, but it's WORTH IT-- the convenience, the location, the pool, the restaurants, and the DISNEY DAILY EXTRA ACCESS to Early Park Entry and Late Park Stays.
